#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Make Frito
#Text=Pie
#Text=Frito pies were invented by the Texas-based Frito Corporation , but adored throughout the Southwestern US .
#Text=You can use your favorite chili recipe , or take this example of a classic Texas red chili .
#Text=Ingredients
#Text=Baked Frito Pie or Walking Tacos
#Text=3 cups Frito chips ( one large bag , or one small bag per person )
#Text=½ yellow onion , diced
#Text=1 cup ( 240 mL ) sour cream
#Text=1 cup grated cheddar cheese
#Text=1 16-oz ( 450g ) can chili ( or homemade chili , below )
#Text=1 fresh tomato , diced or ½ can diced tomato ( optional )
#Text=⅓ head lettuce , shredded ( optional )
#Text=Texas Red Chili
#Text=3 dried chipotle chili peppers
#Text=4 dried ancho chili peppers
#Text=2 pounds ( 0.9 kg ) ground chuck
#Text=1 yellow onion , diced
#Text=2.5 cups ( 950 mL ) chicken or beef stock
#Text=12 oz ( 350 mL ) beer
#Text=1 tbsp ( 15 mL ) cumin
#Text=1.5 tbsp ( 22 mL ) corn flour ( masa )
#Text=pepper and salt
#Text=Steps
#Text=Easy Baked Frito Pie
#Text=Preheat the oven to .
#Text=Now 's a good time to dice the onions , while you wait .
#Text=Spread most of the Fritos in a baking dish .
#Text=Use ⅔ of the Fritos , or enough to cover the whole pan .
#Text=Save the rest for the topping .
#Text=Cover with chili .
#Text=You can use any kind of canned chili , or make your own using the recipe below .
#Text=Optionally , add diced tomatoes , canned or fresh .
#Text=Bake for 15 minutes .
#Text=Once your oven is preheated , put the casserole dish in the oven .
#Text=Leave it for about fifteen minutes , until the chili is hot .
#Text=For an even easier recipe , add all the ingredients on top of the chili and bake in one sitting .
#Text=Top with other ingredients .
#Text=Spread a layer of sour cream over the chili with a spoon .
#Text=Top with the diced onion , the rest of the Fritos , and the grated cheese .
#Text=The Fritos on top will stay much crunchier than the Fritos at the bottom of the pan .
#Text=Optionally , sprinkle the sour cream layer with shredded lettuce for a fresher taste .
#Text=Bake for another five minutes .
#Text=Return to the oven and bake a few minutes longer , until the cheese is melted .
#Text=Serve hot .
#Text=Walking Tacos
#Text=Heat chili on the stove .
#Text=Pour the can of chili into a pan over medium heat .
#Text=Cover and let warm , stirring occasionally .
#Text=You can make homemade chili instead , or use the recipe below .
#Text=For more flavor , add diced tomatoes and/or canned beans if the canned chili does not include them .
#Text=Most Texan chili skips both of these ingredients .
#Text=Slit open the side of each Frito bag .
#Text=A " walking taco " is a Frito pie served in the Frito bag instead of a bowl .
#Text=Each person gets one Frito bag .
#Text=Cut each bag open along the side instead of the top to make a larger opening .
#Text=Spoon chili and cheese into each bag .
#Text=Spoon the chili directly into the Frito bag , then top with melted cheese .
#Text=You can leave this as is to keep the chips crunchy , or stir it together for a delicious mess .
#Text=Diced onions and sour cream are optional toppings .
#Text=If you want room for more chili , crush some of the chips first by squeezing the bag .
#Text=Texas Red Chili
#Text=Cut and toast the dried chili peppers .
#Text=Slice open the peppers and remove the seeds , stem , and white inner flesh .
#Text=Heat a dry skillet and toast the peppers for about 30 seconds on each side , until dark spots begin to appear .
#Text=You can skip this step and use chili powder instead , but whole dried chili peppers give a much better flavor .
#Text=Do not touch your eyes until you 've washed your hands thoroughly .
#Text=Wear gloves if you have sensitive skin .
#Text=If you like extra-spicy , chili , set aside some of the seeds and add them once the chili is cooking .
#Text=Soak the peppers in hot water .
#Text=Submerge in 1 cup ( 240 mL ) of hot water , not boiling water , for 5 – 10 minutes .
#Text=Puree the peppers and water in a blender and set them aside for now .
#Text=If you think you 'll use them again , you can make a large batch in advance .
#Text=For maximum flavor , soak for 30 minutes and simmer in oil , covered , for another 20 minutes .
#Text=Brown ground chuck in a large frying pan .
#Text=Add the beef to a hot frying pan and cook until brown .
#Text=Stir occasionally and break it into even-sized pieces with a wooden spoon .
#Text=For best results , brown in small batches , so most of the beef can touch the pan surface .
#Text=This will take a few minutes per batch .
#Text=Use a nonstick pan , or nonstick cooking spray .
#Text=Cook the onions until translucent .
#Text=Add the diced onions to the hot pan and cook until translucent , about five minutes .
#Text=Combine chili ingredients in a large saucepan .
#Text=Combine chili pepper puree , beef , and onions in a large pot .
#Text=The larger and heavier the pot , the better the meat texture will be .
#Text=Add the chicken or beef stock , beer , cumin , a grind of pepper , and several pinches of salt .
#Text=If food has stuck to the frying pan , deglaze it with some of the stock and add it to the chili .
#Text=Red ale or stout is a good choice .
#Text=Replace with more stock for a nonalcoholic version ; otherwise , about 25 % of the alcohol will remain .
#Text=Simmer until the meat is tender .
#Text=Bring to a boil , then simmer uncovered until the meat is tender and the chili is thick , 45 – 60 minutes .
#Text=Stir occasionally .
#Text=For extra flavor , instead cover with a slightly ajar lid and cook for up to 3 hours .
#Text=Mix in corn flour paste ( optional ) .
#Text=This makes a thicker , less greasy chili .
#Text=Add the corn flour to a bowl and spoon in some of the chili broth .
#Text=Stir until it forms a paste , then pour it into the chili .
#Text=Stir until thoroughly combined .
#Text=Adjust spices and serve .
#Text=Taste the chili .
#Text=Add more salt , pepper , or cumin if desired .
#Text=Let it sit off the heat to absorb more flavor and cool enough to eat .
#Text=Serve with Fritos and grated cheese .
#Text=Squeeze a lime over it for extra flavor .
#Text=For sweet chili , stir in 1 tbsp ( 15 mL ) brown sugar and 1 tbsp ( 15 mL ) white vinegar , then let simmer another ten minutes .
#Text=Finished .
#Text=Video
#Text=Tips
#Text=Add spices or other ingredients to customize the recipe , or follow a different chili recipe .
#Text=You can use any type of chili pepper you like .
#Text=For best results , combine two or more peppers with different flavors .
#Text=Try a smoky chipotle or guajillo with a fruity ancho or pasillo , and an extra-hot pequin or arbol .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=In the UK and some other regions , corn starch is sold as " cornflour .
